What is the reward schedule for Verus, and how does it incentivize long-term support for the network and project?

The reward schedule for Verus is designed to incentivize long-term support for the network and project. It consists of multiple eras, each with a different block reward structure. In the early stages, the reward curve is accelerated, with a halving every month for the first 5 months. This is intended to encourage early adoption and support.

In Era 1, the block reward rises linearly from 0 to 384 over the first 10,080 blocks. In Era 2, the reward remains constant at 384 for a period, then halves every 26,199 blocks, eventually reaching 24. In Era 3, the reward continues to halve every 1,051,200 blocks, approximately every 2 years.

To ensure a smooth release of the Verus currency supply and incentivize long-term support, Verus implements a time-locked coinbase transaction system. During the first two months, when the block rewards are at or above 192 Verus, mined blocks will have time-locked coinbase transactions, preventing spending, staking, or transferring of those coins for a period ranging from approximately 3 months to 2 years and 3 months.

This design aims to encourage participants to support the long-term success of the Verus network and project, rather than focusing on short-term gains. By providing a stable and predictable reward structure, Verus aims to create a sustainable and equitable environment for all participants.

Additionally, Verus operates with a dual proof of stake/proof of work mechanism, using the CPU-only VerusHash algorithm, which is designed to be quantum secure and maximize performance on modern CPUs. The algorithm is intended to be fair and accessible, without giving an unfair advantage to any particular group of miners.
